moves.4. g3 d6: ...Black errs here. The correct move was ...P-Q4, as in this formation ...P-K3 is Black's logical set-up.
moves.5. Bg2 Nd7 6. Qb3: Taking advantage of the mistake. If Black's pawns were on Q4 and K3, this diagonal would be effectively blocked.
moves.6... d5 7. Ng5 Ndf6 8. Bf4: White's attack is already beginning to look formidable.
moves.8... Qd7 9. Na3 h6 10. Nf3 g5 11. Ne5: This dagger thrust gives White a huge positional edge. Black is doomed if White doesn't blow it.
moves.13... Kd8 14. h4 a6 15. Na3 Nxe5 16. dxe: Now the White rooks are active. The final blow approaches.
moves.17... Kc8 18. Rxd5: Sacrificing to tear open Black's defenses.
moves.18... Bxd5 19. Bxd5: With the disappearance of the protecting Bishop, Black's Queen-side is ready to collapse.
moves.19... Qxe5 20. Bd4 Qxe2 21. Bxh8: Winning back the material, as well. Black has nothing left to play for.
moves.23. Kb1 Rb8 24. Nc2: Black resigns. His position has been shattered.
